snippet: An artist who received a favorable court ruling this week after a years-long rent strike is one of several tenants in her Brooklyn building who had maintained it themselves for many years.
abstract: New York State Court of Appeals rules that Brooklyn artist Margaret Maugenest can stay in her loft apartment, even though she has deliberately not paid rent since 2003, because the landlord had not complied with safety provisions of the city building code; Maugenest and several other residents have maintained the structure for many years and brought it in compliance with residential building codes on their own.
lead_paragraph: An artist who received a favorable court ruling this week after a years-long rent strike is one of several tenants in her Brooklyn building who had maintained it themselves for many years.

headline.seo: Loft Tenant Explains Reasons for Rent Strike
headline.main: Withholding Rent, a Loft Tenant Comes Out on Top
headline.print_headline: Withholding Rent, a Loft Tenant Comes Out on Top
